    • Method Detail

      • getLightData

        public double getLightData()
        Polls the LightSensor1 and returns the amount of light the LightSensor1 detected
        Returns:
        the light value between 0 and 100, with 0 = light and 100 = dark

      • getColorData

        public float[] getColorData()
        Polls the LightSensor2 and returns the an array containing the amount of light reflected of each color
        Returns:
        an array containing the red, blue and green light values between 0 and 100, with 0 = low and 100 = high

      • isLine

        public boolean isLine()
        Compares the value detected by LightSensor1 to a threshold (i.e. if there's a line) and returns the result
        Returns:
        true if the light value is smaller than the threshold, otherwise returns false

      • isBlue

        public boolean isBlue()
        Compares the values detected by LightSensor2 to thresholds (i.e. if the block is blue) and returns the result
        Returns:
        true if the blue light is bigger than the threshold, otherwise returns false
